Some of her notable works include "Under the Net" (1954), "The Bell" (1958), and "The Sea, The Sea" (1978), which won the Booker Prize.

Angus Wilson (1913-1991) was a British novelist and essayist, best known for his novels that explored the complexities of British society and the human condition. Some of his notable works include "Hemlock and After" (1952), "The Middle Age of Mrs. Eliot" (1958), and "As If by Enchantment" (1965).
